name: Accademia Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Accademia Hotel for one night with my husband and my brother and his partner. Chose it based on reviews here and they were right! Got rooms beside each other. We were on foot, hotel was easy to find and very central. Room was beautiful, clean, very comfortable and inviting more than any other Italian hotel we stayed in so far. Breakfast was great, drinks in the hotel bar were great and all the staff were friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: Would Love to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was very clean and similar to American hotels than the other hotels we stayed at in Italy. Beautiful marble bathroom and the room were very clean. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip 1 - if you have a car be sure to let the hotel know if advance to assist with parking and getting to the hotel. Most streets by the hotel are restricted traffic and you may get a ticket if you drive in this area.
reviews.title: Great location, gloomy rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip 2 - if you are here in July/August/Sept eat dinner at one of the restaurants outside the Arena. You can hear the opera music performed.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about the Accademia is its location - everything you're likely to want to see is within a few minutes' walk. But if you're looking for a hotel that feels luxurious, this isn't it. Our room was seriously gloomy and 40w lightbulbs didn't help. One real downside is the lack of tea or coffee making facilities. Service is thin on the ground (try getting served in the bar) so we didn't even attempt room service. Instead we breakfasted every day in the dazzlingly overlit restaurant just for a coffee fix. Overall impression: a bit grim.
reviews.title: A Welcoming and Comfortable Hotel in a Terrific Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a friendly and comfortable hotel in the historical centre of Verona.
reviews.title: central and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: It is superbly located. However, have in mind that if you need to park, it will cost you an additional 23 euro per day in the hotel’s private underground garage, which is just around the corner.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving in the centre of Verona is restricted. Make sure the hotel reports your car’s registration number to the police, to avoid a stiff fine.
reviews.title: Well worth the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a “superior room” . It was nice, spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Affordable luxury in gorgeous Verona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet in the room is free and there is also a “computer corner” with a printer near reception.
reviews.title: Excellent city-break hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reservation and reception service was excellent. The staff were very patient in answering questions about the hotel services, meals, excursions etc.
reviews.title: A hidden gem in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked for and were given a quiet double room on a high floor (389). This was a really good size and was very comfortable. We ate in the downstairs restaurant on our first night and the quality of food and service exceeded our expectations. The hotel recommended the Restaurant Maffei for our second night where the food, service and atmosphere was excellent. This hotel is ideally located in the centre of the old town within easy walking distance of all the main sights. Reasonable bar prices too. My only gripe would be the poor choice of food at breakfast but this is fairly typical of European city hotels .
reviews.title: Old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A top tip from reception was to buy the Verona Card which costs 10 or 15 euros for one or three days respectively. This card gives you free access to all the main sites including churches which otherwise charge an entrance fee of between 4.50 to 6.00 euros each.
reviews.title: Great location and good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely stay here when we next return to Verona.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel full of old world charm. A bit pricey, but it makes for a perfect romantic getaway. Staff is helpful. Breakfast is great. Rooms are small, but tastefully decorated. Parking is available, but a bit of a pain, as you have to drive to the parking with a valet. Location is perfect, right in the center of the historic town. You can walk everywhere, so no need for the car again once parked.
reviews.title: Perfect location, but needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is an ideal hotel in terms of location - it is right smack in the centre of the city of Verona and a step away from the main shopping street and places of interest. So it is also to be expected that this hotel would be popular amongst tour groups, which it caters to of course. So be prepared for relatively large crowds of guests in this hotel, especially during peak periods.
reviews.title: Large Tourist Class Hotel in the Heart of Verona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were in Verona for 2 nights in early November 2011 and hence, did not see the large crowds. That was a plus point. Besides the location being ideal, the rooms were generally clean and functional, though not more than the typical 3 star hotel in Europe. Housekeeping was generally prompt and responsive. However, don't expect top-notch standards. This is an old hotel and it shows here and there.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel staff are generally austere and don't seem to smile much. Then again, I was told that this is typical of the Veneto and Trentino regions of Italy.
reviews.title: Brilliant location, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was surprisingly good with a relatibely large array of "continental" offerings.
reviews.title: Top quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all, it is a good hotel for just a couple of nights in a lovely city.
reviews.title: Location, rooms, staff, value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in double room for one night in August for the Opera.
reviews.title: Central Location for the Opera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel on location - and it is great. Right in the centre of Verona and after the opera which finishes at 1.00 a.m. we were back in hotel in 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Excellent ....Location, Friendly Staff, A Nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms dated and bit miserable as is breakfast room.
reviews.title: good place on best location but value for money?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff helpful and a very useful car park (at a cost 22 e) just two minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you just want a base for one or two nights in the very centre - then this is fine. A small cafe adjoins the hotel with tables on pavement. Served the most perfect cappuccino's - unlikely but true!!
reviews.title: Good old fashioned upmarket hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderfully central position, - witihin walking distance of all the main attractions, round the corner from the main shopping street. Staff very helpful and friendly, breakfast great. We had a superior room which was huge, with sitting area , great bathroom and looked onto a quiet courtyard, so we were able to sleep with the windows open. Higly recomment this hotel to anyone visiting Verona.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Verona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Accademia has a few advantages: the location in the old town of Verona is superb, the distance to the arena is only a few mintues and the staff is pretty helpful.
reviews.title: Bit of a disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we were put in a room in the very back of the hotel. The way to get to the room was past closets with linen and cleaners. This is not the kind of entrance to your room on a romantic getaway. The view the room provided us was a blind wall and a messy patio. No direct daylight. We called reception and asked if a nicer room was available but unfortunately she could not help us.
reviews.title: A really good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a daily rate of €275 (excluding 22€ for the parking garage).
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price/quality was below expectations. I have sent the hotel a very polite e-mail to inform them on the perception the hotel left us. We received no response at all.
reviews.title: Perfection
Great location
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the center of the old city of Verona within easy walking distance to all the major attractions. The rooms are clean and spacious with an excellent bathroom. Service was friendly and helpful. Parking is extra (23 euros) in the hotel garage but the staff accompanies you to help you navigate. The included breakfast was extensive and delicious.

reviews.title: Great little Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is in one of the best locations in Verona. Right in the heart of everything you can walk to all the sights and restaurants and come back to change shoes or drop off shopping or get a jacket. The breakfast Is the best I have had in Europe, really very good. The hotel restaurant is average but there are many many choices close at hand. Good service and help with finding a car and driver for the day to go to the Lake Garda area which was an excellent choice and way to spend 7 hours!!.Inner courtyard suite 113 was very roomy with separate lounge and quiet.

reviews.title: Not all floors had direct elevator service
reviews.text: My complaint is that although the hotel's descriptionstates an elevator, it does not state that you may get a room that does not have direct acess to it. We had to go through 3 different sets of steps to get to our room. This was very annoying. Had we known of this it probably would not have been a big deal. The hotel is expensive but that was our choice. So be aware if you have a problem climbing steps

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Nothing like 3 weeks in the same hotel to really see it's consistency. I have stayed many times for extended periods at Hotel Accademia and the experiences always consistently pleasing. The location can't be beat! Right on Mazzini half way between Piazzas Bra and del Erbe and the price for the location and calibre of hotel is a great value! While the rooms are not ultra plush, they are the standard+ for a European 4 star. They are immaculately cleaned and the bathrooms are adequate to large. Most importantly, the staff go out of their way to make your stay pleasant from bell and desk service to concierge service. They have given me many great restaurant recommendations as well. The included buffet breakfast is also very nice.
reviews.title: Perfect location! Attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent location in the heart of the city centre. Hotel was clean, staff were very attentive and extremely helpful. We stayed here for 2 nights, kids loved it. Breakfast had a lot of variety and the staff were great.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Six of us had the pleasure of four days at Accademia in Verona. We booked three rooms and each was unique. The furnishings were of high quality, the rooms quiet and the service throughout our stay was excellent. For us location was key. The Accademia is in the heart of Verona and is as convenient to the Arena as it is to Piazza Erbe. Situated on a cross street (Via Scala) to Via Mazzini evening strolls were easy (although there is a danger associated with being close to so much fine shopping).
reviews.title: Location, quality and service - all excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the first day the reception desk recommended a cafe for lunch - Antico Caffe Dante. It was a perfect respite from driving - I'll provide a review of that experience as well. Suffice it to say that they did well by us.
reviews.title: Ideally located for tourist sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers parking (fee) in a nearby garage. We were travelling in a 9 passenger van and it was a tight fit. One of the bell staff came with me to park the van and got me in and out without a scratch.
reviews.title: Accademia Hotel
Great Hotel in Centre of Verona
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights for a short break in Verona. Great location only a few minutes walk from main attractions like the Roman arena and Juliet's house. The hotel is just off the main shopping street in Verona, Via Mazzini.

reviews.title: Central Verona location, comfortable with good service
reviews.text: Great service, helpful staff providing maps and directions to key attractions. Good breakfast to start the day. Room very comfortable.

reviews.title: Will be back to the Accademia
reviews.text: The hotel also serves free tea and coffee in the afternoon so great for dropping in for a quick break from sight seeing/shopping!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Verona would have to be one of my favorite towns for walking and exploring. It has lots of old alleyways to explore with a wonderful market, great restaurants and good shopping.
reviews.title: Perfectly located hotel for walking & exploring this amazing city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very glad of our GPS as we drove from Bergamo- the hotel is located nar the centre of the old town- there are lots of one way streets and and a pedestrain shared pathway to traverse to get near the front door. We were met by a porter who took our bags and walked to the parking garage while I drove- good service!!
reviews.title: Excellent central location in wonderful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in was handled very well- smart older gentlemen handling the desk. My first overall impressions were that the hotel could do with a freshen up but our room was large and on the corner above the pretty cool bookshop. With the windows open we could hear some of the pedestrian traffic but once the heavy windows were closed it was not a problem (the fresh air was lovely).
reviews.title: Great location and helpful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The carpet in our room and in the passageways was getting a bit worn, the bathroom was older style but was clean.
reviews.title: great location , very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was ok, it was served in a non descript kind of room devoid of much decoration- the coffee was excellent.
reviews.title: Marvelous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: I found the hotels smalll and stuffy, and although the foyer was very nice the rooms let the hotel down. However, the bathrooms were nice and modern which made it more comfortable and the location was wonderful, right in the heart of Verona. Breakfast had a good selection although the coffee was very poor considering it's Italy! Overall, a dated hotel but fine for a brief stay.
reviews.title: Great location but hotel nothing special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Right in the center of the city is this wonderful hotel whose lobby, bar and dinner rooms appear stuck in time, circa 1950s/'60s. It's a bit run down here and there but the place is very well run the rooms adequate and the morning breakfast room a highlight with a marvelous selection of locate patisserie - forget the eggs and cereal and go for the carbs. Around the corner from the mail shopping street and in between the Arena plaza and the Piazza del Erbe which is filled with (the better) bars and restuarants. Don't forget Dante's square in the evening with the tower view and two quieter, quality restuarants.
reviews.title: Classic hotel at the crossroads of Verona

description: Hotel Accademia si trova nel centro storico della città di Verona, tra la Piazza Brà con l'Arena, che nel periodo estivo diventa capitale della lirica e la Piazza delle Erbe con la casa ed il balcone di Giulietta, famosa in tutto il mondo per l'opera di Shakespeare. Facilmente raggiungibili anche tutte le mete del divertimento posizionate nel vicino Lago di Garda.L’albergo è dotato di 94 camere, 6 sale riunioni, american bar, ristorante e servizio di video sorveglianza interna. Il confort, l’atmosfera, l’efficienza del servizio accolgono nel modo migliore il cliente d’affari ed il turista più esigente. Pur essendo l’albergo situato nel cuore della città in zona a traffico limitato, l’accesso ai veicoli dei nostri ospiti ed a quelli degli accompagnatori è consentito senza alcuna limitazione di orario, attraverso semplice comunicazione del numero di targa della vettura al nostro personale di Ricevimento al momento dell’arrivo. Il nostro garage privato si trova a cento metri dall’hotel.The Accademia Hotel is in the center of Verona. Well placed on the via Mazzini, the hotel is in the heart of the exclusive shopping area of Verona, conveniently positioned between the Brà Square and the Arena. Nearby is the Erbe Square and Giulietta's House with its legendary balcony. The hotel has 94 bedrooms, 6 conference rooms, a restaurant, American bar, and internal video surveillance service. Our management takes pride in the comfort, atmosphere and efficiency of service offered to all guests, whether in Verona for business or pleasure. Although the hotel is situated in the heart of town inside the limited traffic area, access to vehicles of our guests and to those of accompanying persons is allowed without any limitation of time, through simple communication of the car plate number to our Reception staff on arrival. Our private garage is located a hundred meters from the hotel.
